sect2.title: Utilities
sect2.para: The GNOME utilities have some improvements, such as:

sect3.title: Text Editor
sect3.para:
The GNOME text editor can now highlight the current line and, when editing program source code, it highlights matching braces. It also starts faster than previous versions.
Text Editor
The text editor, highlighting the current line.

sect3.title: Archive Manager
sect3.para:
The GNOME archive manager can now open more types of archive, including AR, Debian, and 7-zip archives, and password-protected RAR archives. And if you use the single-click preference in the file manager, then the archive manager will now use single clicks too.
Text Editor
The file manager, asking for a password for a RAR file.

sect3.title: Search Tool
sect3.para:
The search tool can now do a second search inside the results from your first search, to narrow down the results. TODO: Is this true? And like the archive manager, it now uses single clicks if that's what you've chosen in the file manager preferences.
Text Editor
The search tool.

sect3.title: Dictionary
sect3.para:
The GNOME Dictionary now suggests words when you aren't sure how to spell something. The definitions also contain links to external dictionary web sites, and the definitions can be printed.
Text Editor
The dictionary, suggesting possible spellings and a definition.

sect3.title: Floppy Formatter
sect3.para:
The GNOME Floppy Formatter utility now supports removable drives, such as USB drives, using the standard HAL system from freedesktop.org.
Floppy Formatter
Formatting a floppy disk.
